# rtx_ethernet_filter (Resource)

Manages Ethernet (Layer 2) filters on RTX routers. Ethernet filters can match traffic based on MAC addresses or DHCP binding status.



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `action` (String) Action to take: pass-log, pass-nolog, reject-log, reject-nolog, pass, reject
- `sequence` (Number) Sequence number determining evaluation order. Lower numbers are evaluated first (1-512).

### Optional

- `byte_list` (List of String) Byte patterns for byte-match filtering
- `destination_mac` (String) Destination MAC address (e.g., 00:11:22:33:44:55 or * for any)
- `dhcp_scope` (Number) DHCP scope number (for DHCP-based filters)
- `dhcp_type` (String) DHCP filter type: dhcp-bind or dhcp-not-bind
- `ether_type` (String) Ethernet type (e.g., 0x0800 for IPv4, 0x0806 for ARP)
- `offset` (Number) Byte offset for byte-match filtering
- `source_mac` (String) Source MAC address (e.g., 00:11:22:33:44:55 or * for any)
- `vlan_id` (Number) VLAN ID to match (1-4094)

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.
